newsitem.title: USA: Cooper says electrical products helped Q2.
newsitem.headline: Cooper says electrical products helped Q2.

text.p: Cooper Industries Inc said Thursday its second quarter earnings are the result of continued strong momentum in its electrical products business, and a rebound in the performance of its Tools & Hardware segment.
The company also said its automotive products business is "holding its own in a very difficult worldwide market."

The company said it made a decision during the second quarter to exit certain lower-margin product lines, which it said it expects will lead to significant margin improvement in its automotive products segment.

The company also said that in its electrical products segment, its power systems business will benefit from the recent acquisition of Kearney Co and the a major restructuring of distribution transformer manufacturing processes.
The company reported fully diluted earnings per share of $0.86 compared to $0.77 for the same period a year ago.
Revenues for the electrical products segment were up 8 percent during the quarter, and revenues for the automotive products segment were down 2 percent in the quarter.
The company said automotive products revenues reflected, among other things, generally weak demand for wiper and temperature control products.
